trans-unit.source: Publishing Apps with Azure AD Application Proxy
trans-unit.target: Publishing Apps with Azure AD Application Proxy

trans-unit.source: Covers how to publish on-premises applications using Azure AD Application Proxy.
trans-unit.target: Covers how to publish on-premises applications using Azure AD Application Proxy.

trans-unit.source: Application Proxy is a feature that is available only if you upgraded to the Premium or Basic edition of Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Application Proxy is a feature that is available only if you upgraded to the Premium or Basic edition of Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Azure Active Directory editions</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Azure Active Directory editions</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: After you enable Microsoft Azure AD Application Proxy, you can publish applications to make them accessible for your users outside your private network.
trans-unit.target: After you enable Microsoft Azure AD Application Proxy, you can publish applications to make them accessible for your users outside your private network.

trans-unit.source: This section walks you through the steps necessary to publish applications that are running on your local network for which you want to enable secure remote access from outside your network.
trans-unit.target: This section walks you through the steps necessary to publish applications that are running on your local network for which you want to enable secure remote access from outside your network.

trans-unit.source: To verify that the Connector is running properly, the first application you publish should be any website accessible from within your private network to assure users can access it from the Internet, before publishing an actual application.
trans-unit.target: To verify that the Connector is running properly, the first application you publish should be any website accessible from within your private network to assure users can access it from the Internet, before publishing an actual application.

trans-unit.source: Open a browser of your choice and go to the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Open a browser of your choice and go to the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane of the Azure Management Portal, click the Active Directory tab.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane of the Azure Management Portal, click the Active Directory tab.

trans-unit.source: Click the directory in which you enabled Application Proxy and for which you want to publish an application (for example, Wingtip Toys).
trans-unit.target: Click the directory in which you enabled Application Proxy and for which you want to publish an application (for example, Wingtip Toys).

trans-unit.source: Click the Applications tab, and then click the Add button at the bottom of the screen Add application
trans-unit.target: Click the Applications tab, and then click the Add button at the bottom of the screen Add application

trans-unit.source: In the What do you want to do?
trans-unit.target: In the What do you want to do?

trans-unit.source: dialog box, click Publish an application that will be accessible outside your network.
trans-unit.target: dialog box, click Publish an application that will be accessible outside your network.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New application that will be accessible from outside your network</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New application that will be accessible from outside your network</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions on the screen to provide the following information about your application: <linkText>Application properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions on the screen to provide the following information about your application: <linkText>Application properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Setting
trans-unit.target: Setting

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: External URL
trans-unit.target: External URL

trans-unit.source: This is the URL of the cloud service that is used to access the application from outside your private network.
trans-unit.target: This is the URL of the cloud service that is used to access the application from outside your private network.

trans-unit.source: The URL is automatically generated based on the name you provided, with the suffix msappproxy.net.
trans-unit.target: The URL is automatically generated based on the name you provided, with the suffix msappproxy.net.

trans-unit.source: Preauthentication Method
trans-unit.target: Preauthentication Method

trans-unit.source:
Set the type of preauthentication method you want the application to use:

a. Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Microsoft Azure AD) – sets the preauthentication method to Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Microsoft Azure AD). When a user tries to access an application, Application Proxy will redirect the user to log in with Azure AD which will authenticate the user, ensuring that the user has the necessary permissions for the directory and the application.

b. Pass through –preauthentication is not performed.
trans-unit.target:
Set the type of preauthentication method you want the application to use:

a. Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Microsoft Azure AD) – sets the preauthentication method to Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Microsoft Azure AD). When a user tries to access an application, Application Proxy will redirect the user to log in with Azure AD which will authenticate the user, ensuring that the user has the necessary permissions for the directory and the application.

b. Pass through –preauthentication is not performed.

trans-unit.source: External URL Protocol
trans-unit.target: External URL Protocol

trans-unit.source:
By default, applications are published by using the HTTPS protocol.

To enable HTTP for an internal application, you have to set Preauthentication to Passthrough and then you are able to change the External URL protocol from HTTPS to HTTP.

Note that publishing applications by using HTTP may create security issues for your application and your users.

You can insert a custom domain rather than using the default of msappproxy.net. For more information, see below.
trans-unit.target:
By default, applications are published by using the HTTPS protocol.

To enable HTTP for an internal application, you have to set Preauthentication to Passthrough and then you are able to change the External URL protocol from HTTPS to HTTP.

Note that publishing applications by using HTTP may create security issues for your application and your users.

You can insert a custom domain rather than using the default of msappproxy.net. For more information, see below.

trans-unit.source: Internal URL
trans-unit.target: Internal URL

trans-unit.source: This is the internal URL that the Application Proxy connector uses to access the application internally.
trans-unit.target: This is the internal URL that the Application Proxy connector uses to access the application internally.

trans-unit.source: This should be the URL of the published application that is used to access the application from inside your private network.
trans-unit.target: This should be the URL of the published application that is used to access the application from inside your private network.

trans-unit.source: This is a valid URL with no path and no spaces or symbols.
trans-unit.target: This is a valid URL with no path and no spaces or symbols.

trans-unit.source: To finish the wizard, click the check mark at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: To finish the wizard, click the check mark at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: The application is now defined in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The application is now defined in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source:
For apps that are preauthenticated, you must assign users and groups that will have access to the app.

For apps that are passthrough, access is available for all users. However, in order for a user to see the app in their application list, you must assign the app to that user.
trans-unit.target:
For apps that are preauthenticated, you must assign users and groups that will have access to the app.

For apps that are passthrough, access is available for all users. However, in order for a user to see the app in their application list, you must assign the app to that user.

trans-unit.source: After finishing the Add App wizard, the App Proxy Quick Start page is displayed.
trans-unit.target: After finishing the Add App wizard, the App Proxy Quick Start page is displayed.

trans-unit.source: To assign users, click Assign users.
trans-unit.target: To assign users, click Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Proxy quick start screen</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Proxy quick start screen</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select each user or group you want to assign to this app and click Assign.
trans-unit.target: Select each user or group you want to assign to this app and click Assign.

trans-unit.source: For Integrated Windows Authentication apps, you can assign only users and groups that are synced from your on-prem Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: For Integrated Windows Authentication apps, you can assign only users and groups that are synced from your on-prem Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Users logging in using a Microsoft account and guests cannot be assigned for apps published with Azure Active Directory Application Proxy.
trans-unit.target: Users logging in using a Microsoft account and guests cannot be assigned for apps published with Azure Active Directory Application Proxy.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the users you assign log in with their credentials that are part of the same domain as the app you are publishing.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the users you assign log in with their credentials that are part of the same domain as the app you are publishing.

trans-unit.source: You can modify published apps or configure advanced options, such as SSO to on-prem applications, from the Configure page.
trans-unit.target: You can modify published apps or configure advanced options, such as SSO to on-prem applications, from the Configure page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Advanced configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Advanced configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the app and click Configure.
trans-unit.target: Select the app and click Configure.

trans-unit.source: The following options are available:
trans-unit.target: The following options are available:

trans-unit.source: Setting
trans-unit.target: Setting

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Provide a descriptive name for your application
trans-unit.target: Provide a descriptive name for your application

trans-unit.source: External URL
trans-unit.target: External URL

trans-unit.source: This is the URL of the cloud service that is used to access the application from outside your private network.
trans-unit.target: This is the URL of the cloud service that is used to access the application from outside your private network.

trans-unit.source: The URL is automatically generated based on the name you provided, with the suffix msappproxy.net.
trans-unit.target: The URL is automatically generated based on the name you provided, with the suffix msappproxy.net.

trans-unit.source: Preauthentication Method
trans-unit.target: Preauthentication Method

trans-unit.source:
Set the type of preauthentication method you want the application to use:

Active directory – sets the preauthentication method to Active Directory. When a user tries to access an application, Application Proxy will redirect the user to log in with Application Proxy which will authenticate the user, ensuring that the user has the necessary permissions for the directory and the application.

Pass through –preauthentication is not performed.
trans-unit.target:
Set the type of preauthentication method you want the application to use:

Active directory – sets the preauthentication method to Active Directory. When a user tries to access an application, Application Proxy will redirect the user to log in with Application Proxy which will authenticate the user, ensuring that the user has the necessary permissions for the directory and the application.

Pass through –preauthentication is not performed.

trans-unit.source: External URL
trans-unit.target: External URL

trans-unit.source: By default, applications are published by using the HTTPS protocol.
trans-unit.target: By default, applications are published by using the HTTPS protocol.

trans-unit.source: To enable HTTP for an internal application, you have to set Preauthentication to Passthrough and then you are able to change the External URL protocol from HTTPS to HTTP.
trans-unit.target: To enable HTTP for an internal application, you have to set Preauthentication to Passthrough and then you are able to change the External URL protocol from HTTPS to HTTP.

trans-unit.source: Note that publishing applications by using HTTP may create security issues for your application and your users.
trans-unit.target: Note that publishing applications by using HTTP may create security issues for your application and your users.

trans-unit.source: You can set a custom domain rather than using the default domain provided (msappproxy.net).
trans-unit.target: You can set a custom domain rather than using the default domain provided (msappproxy.net).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Working with Custom Domains.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Working with Custom Domains.

trans-unit.source: Internal URL
trans-unit.target: Internal URL

trans-unit.source: This is the internal URL that the Application Proxy Connector uses to access the application internally.
trans-unit.target: This is the internal URL that the Application Proxy Connector uses to access the application internally.

trans-unit.source: This should be the URL of the published application that is used to access the application from inside your private network.
trans-unit.target: This should be the URL of the published application that is used to access the application from inside your private network.

trans-unit.source: This is a valid URL with no path and no spaces or symbols.
trans-unit.target: This is a valid URL with no path and no spaces or symbols.

trans-unit.source: Translate URL in Headers
trans-unit.target: Translate URL in Headers

trans-unit.source: For applications (such as some SharePoint configurations) that necessitate that the HTTP host headers are not translated, set this to No.
trans-unit.target: For applications (such as some SharePoint configurations) that necessitate that the HTTP host headers are not translated, set this to No.

trans-unit.source: This will disable header translation for both request and response headers.
trans-unit.target: This will disable header translation for both request and response headers.

trans-unit.source: Internal Authentication Method
trans-unit.target: Internal Authentication Method

trans-unit.source:
If you use Application Proxy for preauthentication, you can set an internal authentication method to enable your users to benefit from single-sign on (SSO) to this application.

Select Integrated Windows Authentication (IWA) if your application uses IWA and you can configure Kerberos Constrained Delegation (KCD) to enable SSO for this application.

Select None if your application does not use IWA.

Applications that use IWA must be configured using KCD, otherwise Application Proxy will not be able to publish these applications.

For more information, see SSO for On Prem IWA Apps Using KCD with App Proxy
trans-unit.target:
If you use Application Proxy for preauthentication, you can set an internal authentication method to enable your users to benefit from single-sign on (SSO) to this application.

Select Integrated Windows Authentication (IWA) if your application uses IWA and you can configure Kerberos Constrained Delegation (KCD) to enable SSO for this application.

Select None if your application does not use IWA.

Applications that use IWA must be configured using KCD, otherwise Application Proxy will not be able to publish these applications.

For more information, see SSO for On Prem IWA Apps Using KCD with App Proxy

trans-unit.source: Internal Application SPN
trans-unit.target: Internal Application SPN

trans-unit.source:
This is the Service-Principal-Name (SPN) of the internal application as configured in the on-prem Application Proxy. The SPN is used by the Application Proxy Connector to fetch Kerberos tokens for the application using Kerberos Constrained Delegation (KCD).

For more information, see SSO for On Prem IWA Apps Using KCD with App Proxy
trans-unit.target:
This is the Service-Principal-Name (SPN) of the internal application as configured in the on-prem Application Proxy. The SPN is used by the Application Proxy Connector to fetch Kerberos tokens for the application using Kerberos Constrained Delegation (KCD).

For more information, see SSO for On Prem IWA Apps Using KCD with App Proxy

trans-unit.source: After you publish applications using Azure Active Directory Application Proxy, they appear in the Applications list in Azure AD, and you can manage them there.
trans-unit.target: After you publish applications using Azure Active Directory Application Proxy, they appear in the Applications list in Azure AD, and you can manage them there.

trans-unit.source: If you disable Application Proxy services after you have published applications, the applications are not deleted, but will no longer be accessible from outside your private network.
trans-unit.target: If you disable Application Proxy services after you have published applications, the applications are not deleted, but will no longer be accessible from outside your private network.

trans-unit.source: To view an application and make sure it is accessible, double-click the name of the application.
trans-unit.target: To view an application and make sure it is accessible, double-click the name of the application.

trans-unit.source: If the Application Proxy service is disabled and the application is not available, a warning message appears at the top of the screen.
trans-unit.target: If the Application Proxy service is disabled and the application is not available, a warning message appears at the top of the screen.

trans-unit.source: To delete an application, select an application in the list, and then click Delete.
trans-unit.target: To delete an application, select an application in the list, and then click Delete.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>About Kerberos constrained delegation</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>About Kerberos constrained delegation</linkText><title></title>
